txt.en: Remain on your guard!
'Hrímil Frost-heart!'
Stand with the dwarves
Talk to Durin
'Aye, Durin. This is wisdom indeed!'
The sound of thousands of approaching Orcs reverberates among the mountains!
Remain on your guard!
'Some among my people doubted you would see it. Not I, of course.'
Hrímil flees to the highest peak above Gundabad
'The dragon!'
'That cannot be so, can it?'
'Foolish insects!'
'Everything you have done has been to my design!'
'It was I who whispered poison into the ears of your prince beside the Anvil of Winterstith!'
Prince Durin stands at the Thing-fold to begin the Dwarrowmoot for which he has called.
'It was I who urged him to march on Gundabad too soon, without time enough to ready his forces!'
'Now it will be the death of his people!'
The Dwarrowmoot has begun.
'It matters not.'
The Dwarrowmoot has been interrupted by the dragon!
'The armies I command do not have the will to resist my voice.'
'Wish me good fortune in this, [placeholder].'
Hrímil has escaped on powerful wings, making for the high peak, but her terror is plain to see.
'No... how is this possible...?'
Durin has called for Dwarrowmoot, a gathering of the dwarves that will decide what can be done to wrest Gundabad from the claws of Hrímil Frost-heart.
The Dwarrowmoot came to a sudden end, but Durin has made a decision: it is time to face the dragon and reclaim the Mountain-home!
A murmur of discontent ripples through the crowd of dwarves, and Durin falls silent
'We should hear what he has to say.'
'That depends on what it might be!'
'Aye, so it does!'
'The Dwarrowmoot is over, [placeholder]. Now we have no choice.\n\n'All will be decided in the moments to come!'
'You will honour the prince!'
'He is no prince of mine!'
'Are we not dwarves?'
'Most of us have known only stories of the Mountain-home.'
Talk to Durin
'But those tales are as well-known to us as the names of our near kin.'
'I called for dwarves to take back Gundabad; not just Longbeards, but dwarves.'
'And this be the response: dwarves of every clan, from the far reaches of Middle-earth!'
'Can anything be more clear than this?'
The Dwarrowmoot has been interrupted by the dragon!
'Hear me now: Gundabad belongs not only to the Longbeards, but to all dwarves.'
'Is this not so, Ingór?'
'Heed not the voice of the dragon!'
'These falsehoods have no power over me, Worm!'
'What is that?'
'Lies!'
Their laughter is disturbed by the sound of a rushing wind!
'Do you hear that? We will be surrounded!'
'What just happened?'
'How is it you wield that hammer?'
'What is your name, stranger?'
'And neither do you.'
'For I am Durin the Seventh, the Durin of old reborn anew!'
'He is a dwarf, and he fights for Gundabad.'
'That is enough.'
Instance: The Voice of the Dragon
Observe the Dwarrowmoot
